node.statement: PART 1 - INVERSE VERIFICATION (citing Cycle_Inverse): By Cycle_Inverse, for a cycle (a_1 a_2 ... a_l), the inverse is (a_l ... a_2 a_1), or in standard form starting with the smallest element: (a_1 a_l ... a_2). Applying this: g_1 = (1 6 4 3 7) has inverse (7 3 4 6 1), which in standard form is g_1^{-1} = (1 7 3 4 6). Similarly, g_2 = (1 2 4 5) has inverse (5 4 2 1), which in standard form is g_2^{-1} = (1 5 4 2). These match the given definitions.
